ksdk:manifest.name: MIMXRT106AxxxxA
ksdk:manifest.brief: This is SDK version 2.7.1 manifest file. It describes the content of the MIMXRT106AxxxxA and additional settings for tools that support SDK version 2.7.1

board.name: SLN-ALEXA-IOT
board.description: SLNALEXAIOT: i.MX MIMXRT106A based solution for Amazon's Alexa Voice Service.

specific.content: The NXP SLNALEXAIOT is an ultra-small form-factor turnkey hardware that comes completely integrated with Amazon qualified software for an out of box AVS experience.

example.name: ais_demo_43438
example.brief: Main application for Alexa interaction through AIS (Hardware not enabled on SLN-ALEXA-IOT kit by default). Connectivity enabled through Cypress CYW43438 wifi chip.

example.name: ais_demo_4343W
example.brief: Main application for Alexa interaction through AIS (Hardware enabled on SLN-ALEXA-IOT kit by default). Connectivity enabled through Cypress CYW43438 wifi chip.

example.name: ais_demo_dp83848
example.brief: Main application for Alexa interaction through AIS. Connectivity enabled through DP83848 physical layer with RJ45 Ethernet connector.

example.name: bootloader_43438
example.brief: Project responsible for OTA update and jump into main application (Hardware not enabled on SLN-ALEXA-IOT kit by default). Connectivity enabled through Cypress CYW43438 wifi chip.

example.name: bootloader_4343W
example.brief: Project responsible for OTA update and jump into main application (Hardware enabled on SLN-ALEXA-IOT kit by default). Connectivity enabled through Cypress CYW4343W wifi chip.

example.name: bootloader_dp83848
example.brief: Project responsible for OTA update and jump into main application. Connectivity enabled through DP83848 physical layer with RJ45 Ethernet connector.

example.name: bootstrap
example.brief: Project which validates the integrity of the applications and starts the bootloader

example.name: hello_world
example.brief: The Hello World demo application provides a sanity check for the new SDK build environments and board bring up. The HelloWorld demo prints the "Hello World" string to the terminal using the SDK UART drivers. The purpose of this demo is toshow how to use the UART, and to provide a simple project for debugging and further development.

example.name: hello_world_virtual_com
example.brief: The Hello World demo application provides a sanity check for the new SDK build environments and board bring up. The HelloWorld demo prints the "Hello World" string to the terminal using the SDK UART drivers. The purpose of this demo is toshow how to use the UART, and to provide a simple project for debugging and further development.

example.name: iled_blinky
example.brief: The LED Blinky demo application provides a sanity check for the new SDK build environments and board bring up. The LED Blinky demo uses the systick interrupt to realize the function of timing delay. The example takes turns to shine the LED. The purpose of this demo is to provide a simple project for debugging and further development.

example.name: tfa_configuration
example.brief: The tfa_configuration example demonstrates how to get customized audio experience from TFA amplifier. This app enables the device (mcu + tfa) to communicate with an external tuning application, QuickStudio. External tuning application QuickStudio, from the host side, enables the user to tune the TFA amplifier. As a result of tuning, a header file is generated. When this file is used by the TFA codec driver, the previous tuning will take effect.

example.name: updater
example.brief: Project which is responsible for updating various modules. The modules which will be updated must be bundeled together with this firmware before using the package for an update via the supported channels (AWS OTA, MSD, OTW, etc.).

example.name: usb_aec_alignment_tool
example.brief: The USB AEC alignment tool provides a way of capturing all audio streams to help evaluate the AFE performance and also align the amplifier reference signal with the microphone(s).

example.name: wiced_ble_4343W
example.brief: Demonstrates Cypress WiFi and BLE connected over USDHC/SDIO

example.name: wiced_iperf_43438
example.brief: Demonstrates Cypress WiFi connected over USDHC/SDIO

example.name: wiced_iperf_4343W
example.brief: Demonstrates Cypress WiFi connected over USDHC/SDIO

device.name: MIMXRT106A
device.description: MIMXRT106A: i.MX® MIMXRT106A 600MHz, 512KB SRAM Microcontrollers (MCUs) based on ARM® Cortex®-M7 Core

specific.content: The MIMXRT106A are ARM Cortex-M7 based microcontrollers for embedded applications.
